humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that out of the three sentinel lymph nodes examined, one was positive for metastatic carcinoma (1/2) and two were negative (0/1). This indicates that the patient has metastases in at least one axillary lymph node, which corresponds to N1 according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has cancer in one out of four examined sentinel lymph nodes (1/4 or 1/2, as mentioned in different parts of the report). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
